trisk.analysis

This repository provides analytical tools to explore and interpret Trisk model outputs. The TRISK model requires specific input datasets whose requirements are explained in more details in the documentation of the trisk.model package.

  • trisk.analysis
    • Installation
    • Data Input
    • Usecases
      • Sensitivity analysis
      • Potfolio analysis

Installation

You can install this package directly from GitHub using the remotes package in R.

  1. Install the remotes package if you don’t have it:

    install.packages("remotes")

  2. Install the package from GitHub:

    remotes::install_github("Theia-Finance-Labs/trisk.analysis")

Data Input

We provide consolidated scenarios data from publicly available sources. The Download and run vignette showcases how to access this data.

Note Real-world assets and financial data is not provided due to its closed-source nature. It needs to be pre-processed independantly, following the structure of the mock datasets which are part of the download.
